shelfmark: Vitellius D. xx + Miscellaneous Burnt Cotton Fratments, Bundle I (16)
summary: On the now-missing fol. ‘20’v of this manuscript was a poem in Old English entitled De situ dunelmi. Et de sanctorum reliquiis que ibidem continentur carmen compositum. CUL Ff. 1. 27, pp. 1-40, 73-252 + CCCC 66, pp. 1-114 (s. xiiex) contains the same poem with the same title. The main text in the manuscript was a Latin Life of Cuthbert; 14 leaves of this have survived the Cotton Library fire. Ker reports that ‘the OE was probably of the same hand as the rest of the manuscript’, and that the manuscript is ‘probably from Durham’ (1957, p. 298).

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 20v) Is ðeos burch breome geond breoten rice

admin: Manuscript described by Mary Swan and Owen Roberson with the assistance of Sanne van der Schee, with reference to published scholarship.
